intro: Quararibea dolichosiphon, commonly known as the long-siphon wood or long-siphon tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is valued for its timber and traditional medicinal uses. Its botanical features make it an important component of the forest ecosystem in its native range.
